bug.author: renatobellotti
bug.summary: Malformatted doc page for SGD optimizer
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>URL(s) with the issue:</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/keras/optimizers/SGD#apply_gradients>https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/keras/optimizers/SGD#apply_gradients</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h2>Description of issue (what needs changing):</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h3>Clear description</denchmark-h>
The formatting in the "References" section is wrong; there is a nesterov = True, that has nothing to do with the reference.

comments.comment: "<denchmark-link:http://jmlr.org/proceedings/papers/v28/sutskever13.pdf>http://jmlr.org/proceedings/papers/v28/sutskever13.pdf</denchmark-link> " is this the only thing that should be present?
I don't know, I just realised that there is something wrong with the formatting.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/renatobellotti>@renatobellotti</denchmark-link> I agree there is some formatting required in this page. But, can you please explain what do you meant by "that has nothing to do with the reference"?. I think the reference explain about the importance of . Thanks!

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/jvishnuvardhan>@jvishnuvardhan</denchmark-link> I haven't read the reference, I just saw that this piece of code was no reference, and I couldn't find where it belongs to, so I assumed it should not be in the reference box. Sorry for my ambiguous formulation.
Closing this issue as it was resolved. Thanks!
